clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Trial Comparing Robotic and Open Radical Cystectomy
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Randomized Trial Comparing Robotic and Open Radical Cystectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if using robotic surgical technology during bladder cancer surgery helps to reduce complications during and after the surgery. The removal of the bladder and lymph nodes will be done by a robotic or by an open technique. It may be a Robotic-assisted Radical Cystectomy (RARC) and Pelvic Lymph Node Dissection. Or it may be an Open Radical Cystectomy (ORC) and Pelvic Lymph Node Dissection.

primary_outcome.measure: To compare surgical complications of robotic-assisted radical cystectomy and open radical cystectomy.

secondary_outcome.measure: To examine clinical and pathological outcomes of robotic-assisted radical cystectomy and open radical cystectomy.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: time from anesthesia induction to final skin closure

secondary_outcome.measure: Pathologic findings, including the stage specific, soft tissue surgical margin rate and number of lymph nodes removed.
Bladder cancer recurrence (local, upper tract and distant disease)

secondary_outcome.description: A secondary analysis will be used to determine if the total burden of grade 2-5 complications in the robotic arm is different from the open arm.
Determine if there is a difference in either the number of patients with grade 3-5 complication or the total number of grade 3-5 complication in the two arms of the study.

arm_group.description: This is a prospective, randomized study designed to compare two techniques of radical cystectomy with PLND (open and robotic) for bladder cancer.
This is a prospective, randomized study designed to compare two techniques of radical cystectomy with PLND (open and robotic) for bladder cancer.

intervention.description: Open radical cystectomy, pelvic lymph node dissection and open urinary diversion.

Robotic radical cystectomy, pelvic lymph node dissection and open urinary diversion. Robotic radical cystectomy is routinely performed by robotically trained and experienced minimally invasive surgeons.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age > 18 years.
- Scheduled for radical cystectomy at MSKCC
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior pelvic or abdominal radiation therapy;
- Prior extensive open abdominal surgery, defined by the discretion of the attending surgeon
- Any clinical contraindication for Trendelenburg positioning
